meanings.definition: Denuders: a person or thing that strips something of its covering or surface
meanings.sent1: The denuders removed the old paint from the walls.
meanings.sent2: The denuders of the forest left behind a barren landscape.
meanings.sent3: The denuders at the party were the ones who unwrapped all the gifts too quickly.
meanings.sent4: The denuders of truth reveal the raw reality beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The denuders of the statue carefully chiseled away the outer layer to reveal the masterpiece within.

meanings.definition: Denuders: to strip something of its covering or surface
meanings.sent1: She denuders the bed before changing the sheets.
meanings.sent2: The river denuders the soil along its banks during heavy rains.
meanings.sent3: The chef denuders the vegetables of their skins before cooking.
meanings.sent4: Time denuders the mountains of their lush greenery, leaving only rocky peaks.
meanings.sent5: The wind denuders the trees of their leaves in the autumn, creating a colorful carpet on the ground.
